intro: Carinta pilosa, commonly known as the hairy carinta, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, with five petals and numerous stamens. Carinta pilosa is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks.
